item.title: Racket notes
item.description: Basic #lang Kotlin fun perform(n: Int, edges: List<List<Int>>): List<Int> { val res: MutableList<Int> = ArrayList() val seen = BooleanArray(n) for (edge in edges) { seen[edge[1]] = true } for (i in 0 until n) { if (!seen[i]) { res.add(i) } } return res } List Empty list: null () doesn"t work for null but '() does build a list: (list e1 ... en) Constructor: cons Access head of list: car Access tail of list: cdr Check for empty: null?
